SEARCH
Package Parliament

Class IndianParliamentMenu

java.lang.Object
Parliament.IndianParliamentMenu
public class IndianParliamentMenu extends Object
The IndianParliamentMenu class provides a menu-driven interface for interacting with the Indian Parliament system. It includes functionalities for managing members of parliament, introducing and voting on bills, and viewing relevant information about the Rajya Sabha, Lok Sabha, and bills.

Author: Vinayak Nishad
Date: 29 July 2024
Rollno : 56
Batch : 3
Class : MCA PART- I
Version: 1.0

The class maintains lists of members, bills, and voted bills and provides methods to perform operations such as adding new members, introducing new bills, and viewing or voting on bills.

    addMember(Scanner scanner)

    Introduces a new bill with the specified title, ID, and status.

    lokSabha()
    Displays information about the Lok Sabha, including its composition, term, and the process for extension during emergencies.
    static void
    rajyaSabha()
    Displays information about the Rajya Sabha, including its composition, tenure, and key roles.
    static void
    viewAllBills()
    Displays a list of all introduced bills with their titles, statuses, vote counts, and IDs.
    static void
    viewMembers()
    Displays a list of all current members of parliament with their names, constituencies, and parties.
    static void
    viewVotedBills()
    Displays a list of all bills that have been voted on, including their titles and vote counts.
    static void
    voteOnBill(Scanner scanner)
    Allows the user to vote on a bill specified by its ID.
